alert.note: Alert for Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:24PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Stillwater, west central Big Horn, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 423 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel to near Pryor. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause localized ponding of water on streets and in low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Huntley, Pryor, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine, Molt, Silesia, Acton, Park City and Comanche. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
